intro: Phymatopsis chrysotricha, commonly known as the yellow-hairy phymatopsis, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, yellowish stems and small, white to yellow flowers. It typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often in rocky soils. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in desert ecosystems.
